snippet: Because of a refereeing mistake between Locust Grove and Frederick A. Douglass high schools, Oklahoma’s Class 3A football playoffs had hinged on a judge’s decision.
abstract: District Judge Bernard M Jones II denies request to have all or part of Oklahoma high school football playoff game replayed following critical mistake by referees; cites danger of setting precedent for settling athletic contests in court; Locust Grove High School had won game after last-minute touchdown by Frederick A Douglass High School was negated.
lead_paragraph: Because of a refereeing mistake between Locust Grove and Frederick A. Douglass high schools, Oklahoma’s Class 3A football playoffs had hinged on a judge’s decision.

headline.seo: Court Won’t Intervene in Oklahoma High School Football Playoffs
headline.main: Upon Further Review, by Judge, a Botched Playoff Ruling Stands
headline.print_headline: Upon Further Review, by Judge, a Botched Playoff Ruling Stands
